Articles.Content:
I'm trying to create a simple tank but it is invisible in KSP. I've tried exporting the the texture as mbm, png and tga and needless to say reloaded all the modules after applying changes. Right now I have a cfg, an .mu and  an .mbm file in GameData/MyParts/parts/tank2 directory. The texture appears to work in Unity 

 

 

What am  doing wrong? I have added mesh (selected concave), the texture appears in the asset menu and the scaling is kept 1.0 both in Unity and the cfg file.

Your mesh needs to be a child of gameObject. The partmodule script goes on the parent.

Also, scale 100? Maybe it's not invisible but just absurdly large? What modelling program are you using?
For a quick scale check, spawn a squad-iva in the scene using the parttools. Your parts should be within reasonable scale to it. As said, if its to big or too small it will look like its invisible.
